intro: Colubrina panamensis, commonly known as Panama beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is an important food source for birds and other wildlife in its native habitat.
